title: Renaissance
summary: The Renaissance was a fervent period of European cultural, artistic, political and economic 'rebirth' following the Middle Ages.

content.text: The Renaissance was a fervent period of European cultural, artistic, political and economic 'rebirth' following the Middle Ages. Generally described as taking place from the 14th century to the 17th century, the Renaissance promoted the rediscovery of classical philosophy, literature and art.
The Renaissance saw many significant developments including the emergence of humanism, advances in science and technology, and revolutionary changes in art and architecture.

references.text: Burckhardt, Jacob (1990). The Civilization of the Renaissance in Italy. Penguin Classics.
